# jest/padding-around-test-blocks <Badge type="info" text="Style" />

<div class="rule-meta">
<Alert class="fix" type="info">
<span class="emoji">üõ†Ô∏è</span> An auto-fix is available for this rule.
</Alert>
</div>

### What it does

This rule enforces a line of padding before and after 1 or more test/it statements

### Examples

Examples of **incorrect** code for this rule:

```js
const thing = 123;
test("foo", () => {});
test("bar", () => {});
```

```js
const thing = 123;
it("foo", () => {});
it("bar", () => {});
```

Examples of **correct** code for this rule:

```js
const thing = 123;

test("foo", () => {});

test("bar", () => {});
```

```js
const thing = 123;

it("foo", () => {});

it("bar", () => {});
```

## How to use

To **enable** this rule in the CLI or using the config file, you can use:

::: code-group

```bash [CLI]
oxlint --deny jest/padding-around-test-blocks --jest-plugin
```

```json [Config (.oxlintrc.json)]
{
  "plugins": ["jest"],
  "rules": {
    "jest/padding-around-test-blocks": "error"
  }
}
```

:::
